messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Perceptions
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yes.  I loved it.  It s one of my favorite movies. Mimi
messages.messageBody:
On Wednesday, December 5, 2001, at 12:23 PM, Pam Hartley wrote:

> ----------
>> From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>> To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>> Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1661
>> Date: Wed, Dec 5, 2001, 10:03 AM
>>
>
>> How is it that telling me I sound condescending and patronizing is
>> okay and just a comment on my posts but when I said Sandra was coming
>> across in very negative way that was a personal insult to Sandra?
>
>
> Anybody ever see "Groundhog Day" with Bill Murray?
>
> Pam
>
Yes. I loved it. It's one of my favorite movies.

Mimi

>

>> >
>>
>> > How is it that telling me I sound condescending and patronizing is
>> > okay and just a comment on my posts but when I said Sandra was coming
>> > across in very negative way that was a personal insult to Sandra?
>>

> Yes, an I hated it.


Now, see, I've had a certain fondness for it until recently. But, then, Bill
Murray learned something.

Pam

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Perceptions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/5/2001 1:28:03 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... OH MY GOD!!!! That is exactly what I was thinking LOLOL. What a great movie, eh? lovemary I
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/5/2001 1:28:03 PM Eastern Standard Time,
pamhartley@... writes:


> Anybody ever see "Groundhog Day" with Bill Murray?
>
> Pam
>

OH MY GOD!!!! That is exactly what I was thinking LOLOL. What a great movie,
eh?

lovemary

I cannot judge my own path and SELF, having the knowledge that I have chosen
to come here to experience these specific issues and grow, learn, and
Remember Who I Am.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
